item.title: Designing Data-Intensive Applications: Flashcards for a Book Club
item.description: How did we get here Back when I left Reco, my parting gift to everyone at the company was books üìö. At the time, these were books I haven’t read, but were recommended by the interwebz. The idea was to stay in touch with the team by gifting them good books and loaning them from time to time. That’s how I wrote a book report about “Turn the Ship Around”, for example.

item.title: We Built a Slack Bot for Valet Parking Services: üÖøÔ∏èart 3 | The Data
item.description: Part three of the joint project with my incredibly sharp wife, Olga! This post is a part of a series, so [check out the entire series for context] (https://www.mrnice.dev/tags/slack/). In this post, we’ll dive into how we’ve implemented a Database in our application. The post starts with the design, then moves to implementation of DB connectivity, then the data models themselves, and finally some testing. Upfront, we had to decide if we’ll choose a relational database or something else - and we decided to go relational.
